org.apache.commons.math4.transform

Class RealTransformerAbstractTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.commons.math4.transform.RealTransformerAbstractTest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FastCosineTransformerTest, FastSineTransformerTest

    public abstract class RealTransformerAbstractTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract test for classes implementing the RealTransformer interface. This abstract test handles the automatic generation of random data of various sizes. For each generated data array, actual values (returned by the transformer to be tested) are compared to expected values, returned by the transform(double[], TransformType) (to be implemented by the user: a naive method may be used). Methods are also provided to test that invalid parameters throw the expected exceptions.
    Since:
    3.0

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void testTransformFunction()
      Accuracy check of RealTransformer.transform(UnivariateFunction, double, double, int, TransformType).
      void testTransformFunctionInvalidBounds()
      RealTransformer.transform(UnivariateFunction, double, double, int, TransformType) should throw a NumberIsTooLargeException if sampling bounds are not correctly ordered.
      void testTransformFunctionInvalidDataSize()
      RealTransformer.transform(UnivariateFunction, double, double, int, TransformType) should throw a MathIllegalArgumentException if number of samples is invalid.
      void testTransformFunctionNotStrictlyPositiveNumberOfSamples()
      RealTransformer.transform(UnivariateFunction, double, double, int, TransformType) should throw a NotStrictlyPositiveException if number of samples is not strictly positive.
      void testTransformReal()
      Accuracy check of RealTransformer.transform(double[], TransformType).
      void testTransformRealInvalidDataSize()
      RealTransformer.transform(double[], TransformType) should throw a MathIllegalArgumentException if data size is invalid.

      • testTransformFunctionInvalidBounds

        public void testTransformFunctionInvalidBounds()
        RealTransformer.transform(UnivariateFunction, double, double, int, TransformType) should throw a NumberIsTooLargeException if sampling bounds are not correctly ordered.

      • testTransformReal

        public void testTransformReal()
        Accuracy check of RealTransformer.transform(double[], TransformType). For each valid data size returned by getValidDataSize(i), a random data array is generated with createRealData(i). The actual transform is computed and compared to the expected transform, return by transform(double[], TransformType). Actual and expected values should be equal to within the relative error returned by getRelativeTolerance(i).

      • testTransformFunction

        public void testTransformFunction()
        Accuracy check of RealTransformer.transform(UnivariateFunction, double, double, int, TransformType). For each valid data size returned by getValidDataSize(i), the UnivariateFunction returned by getValidFunction() is sampled. The actual transform is computed and compared to the expected transform, return by transform(double[], TransformType). Actual and expected values should be equal to within the relative error returned by getRelativeTolerance(i).
